parameters.doc: The receiver must be a string in URL-format, a URL object, a hashed string or nil. Nil is a short way of sending the message back to the calling script. (string|url|hash|nil)
parameters.name: receiver

parameters.doc: The id must be a string or a hashed string. (string|hash)
parameters.name: message_id

elements.brief: posts a message to a receiving URL
elements.name: msg.post

elements.description: The format of the string must be "[socket:][path][#fragment]", which is similar to a http URL. When addressing instances, socket is the name of the collection. path is the id of the instance, which can either be relative the instance of the calling script or global. fragment would be the id of the desired component.

parameters.doc: string to create the url from (string)
parameters.name: urlstring

elements.brief: creates a new URL from a string
elements.examples:
local my_url = msg.url("#my_component")
local my_url = msg.url("my_collection:/my_sub_collection/my_instance#my_component")
local my_url = msg.url("my_socket:")
elements.name: msg.url

elements.brief: creates a new URL from separate arguments
elements.name: msg.url
